result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Letter dated 10/24/2022, filed by Dr Collins, regarding Competency Report
Review hearing on November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Motion Order to Seal Victim Identification Key, Signed by Judge Carter on 10/20/2022

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant to have no contact with victim A/restaurant listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

3:44 PM Defendant James R Mueller in court, in custody.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for James R Mueller. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo.   
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. DEFENSE COUNSEL REQUESTS ORDER FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Review hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
